org.jgraphl

Interface BidirectionalGraph<V>

  • Type Parameters:
    V -
    All Superinterfaces:
    AdjacencyGraph<V>, DirectedGraph<V>, Graph<V>, IncidenceGraph<V>, Iterable<V>

    public interface BidirectionalGraph<V>
extends IncidenceGraph<V>, DirectedGraph<V>
    The BidirectionalGraph concept refines IncidenceGraph and adds the requirement for efficient access to the in-edges of each vertex. This concept is separated from IncidenceGraph because for directed graphs efficient access to in-edges typically requires more storage space, and many algorithms do not require access to in-edges. For undirected graphs this is not an issue, since the inEdges() and outEdges() functions are the same, they both return the edges incident to the vertex.
    Complexity guarantees:
    The inEdges() function is required to be constant time. The inDegree() and degree() functions must be linear in the number of in-edges (for directed graphs) or incident edges (for undirected graphs).

    • Method Detail

      • inEdges

        Stream<Edge<V>> inEdges(V u)
        Returns a stream providing access to the in-edges (for directed graphs) or incident edges (for undirected graphs) of vertex u in graph g. For both directed and undirected graphs, the target of an out-edge is required to be vertex u and the source is required to be a vertex that is adjacent to u.
        Parameters:
        u -
        Returns:
        a stream providing access to the in-edges to u

      • inDegree

        default long inDegree(V u)
        Parameters:
        u -
        Returns:
        Returns the number of in-edges (for directed graphs) or the number of incident edges (for undirected graphs) of vertex u in graph g.

      • degree

        default long degree(V u)
        Parameters:
        u -
        Returns:
        Returns the number of in-edges plus out-edges (for directed graphs) or the number of incident edges (for undirected graphs) of vertex u in graph g.
